issue_place_s: Ctesiphon, Seleucia on the Tigris, Parthian Empire
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: long tapered beard with square cut end, wearing tiara with hooks on crest, horn on side and long, curved earflap, lock of hair representing royal wart on forehead; earring visible, Β behind head, diadem with loop at top and four ends
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: seated on throne, Tyche standing right before him, giving him diadem and holding scepter, year above diadem
issue_reverse_legend_s: [BΑΣΙΛΕΩΣ ΒΑΣΙΛΕΩΝ ΑΡΣΑΚΟΥ ΟΛΑΓΑΣΟΥ ΔΙΚΑΙΟΣ ΕΠΙΦΑΝΟΥ ΦΙΛΕΛΛΗΝΟΣ], Between the heads of Tyche and the king is the Greek numeral Ϛ[reverted]KΦ
